font.b: The Administration would like to share great news. The High School principal & guidance counselor are working out details for a full commencement ceremony to honor our graduates of 2020. With restrictions still in place, commencement will be held June 3, 2020 at Brownsville Drive-In. It will be later in the evening than usual and will involve live and recorded video for display on the big screen, with audio streaming through the system's radio frequency into cars. All details will be shared as soon as they are finalized. We want to thank teachers, parents, and students for continuing to excel!

Planned instruction resumes tomorrow. Students with internet access must log into all of their Google Classrooms each day at any time, but teachers can only be reached during their regular scheduled class time. Attendance the first week will be used daily to identify the number of students that will need packets. It's very important for students to log into their classrooms daily. Those without access must call / email the teacher for a copy of packets to complete. We will be reaching out to families midweek for students that have not logged in. Details for packet pickup and completed packet drop off details will be sent midweek.

Please review the attached letter that outlines our planned instruction for distance learning effective Monday. Have a safe and healthy weekend. High school students should email their teachers if they do not have access to Google Classroom or request an equivalent packet.

Tomorrow will be Flexible Instructional Day #2. Students should complete activity #2 in the FID packet provided by the teachers. Please use your computer or toll free number / PIN to contact your teacher during the assigned times if you need assistance with your work.
Beginning tomorrow all children residing in the district between the ages 2 to 18 are eligible for free meals. Pickups are on Mondays and Thursdays form 11 to noon at the following locations:

Reminder students will be completing their FID packets for Days 1-3 beginning Wednesday. A message will go out Friday with directions for next week. Teachers are currently creating packets and Google Classroom for planned instruction to begin next week. Please complete the link for the Technology Survey as we are planning how many paper copies of content to deliver. Paper copies of the survey have been delivered to the food pickup locations for distribution on Thursday. Please see attached FAPE letter for all families of the district

We are happy to attach a letter from Atlantic Broadband offering two months of free internet and equipment to support qualified families during the closure. This is intended to help students get access to distance learning. Our Technology Director is also currently working on preparing all district laptop computers and devices for delivery to families in need. On Monday, a link to a technology survey will be sent to everyone through Remind. Additionally, paper copies will be available at lunch pickup locations throughout the district. Please see the offer.

b.font: Governor Wolf has announced that schools are now closed until April 7, with further delays in returning possible dependent upon the health crisis.

Please see the attached letter from the Superintendent. We will not be utilizing Flexible Instruction Days this upcoming week. The district is anticipating vital information from the Department of Education on Tuesday morning. Please don't forget that this week breakfasts and lunches for All district students can be picked up between 11 a.m. and noon Mondays and Thursdays. Meals (breakfasts and lunches) for three days will be provided on Monday and four on Thursday. Please open and review the attached letter for more detailed information.

font.b: Please be advises that effective Friday, March 20, 2020 at noon district buildings and grounds are completely closed to all non-life sustaining employees. Our food service director and cafeteria workers will be working Monday and Thursday to prepare and deliver meals to drop off spots for all Beth-Center students. Administration and teachers are working together to develop plans for the continuation of learning for our students. Although we do not have any concrete information, recent developments indicate the potential for extending the school closure. We will update as new information is received.

We just received word that approval was granted for our meal waiver. We will now offer breakfast and lunch to all students i the district for all 7 days a week. Starting next week, meals will be delivered twice a week on Mondays and Thursdays. on Monday, breakfasts and lunched for three days will be handed out and Friday for the remaining three days. We also received word directly from the media that all standardized testing has been cancelled for for the school year. No PSSA's or Keystones. We will keep you updated, Bless you all!

p.font: Governor Wolf Announces Closure of Pennsylvania Schools

Today, Governor Tom Wolf announced that all K-12 Pennsylvania schools will be closed for 10 business days effective Monday, March 16. The administration has been working with school districts as well as state and local officials to gather input on this decision. The Wolf Administration will continue to monitor Covid-19 in the commonwealth, and at the end of 10 days will reevaluate and decide whether continued closure is needed.
Governor Wolf made the following statement:
We understand that these are trying times and recognize the impact of the coronavirus on our students and communities.
First and foremost, my top priority as governor – and that of our education leaders – must be to ensure the health and safety of our students and school communities.
As such, I am ordering that all schools in the commonwealth close for the next two weeks.
Be aware that no school district will be penalized if it fails to meet the 180 day or school hours requirements.
The Department of Education will work with intermediate units and other stakeholders to support school districts with any continuity of learning plans they may be pursuing.

Also, the Pennsylvania Department of Education announced today that it received a waiver from the U.S. Department of Agriculture to allow eligible schools to serve meals to low income students in a non-congregate setting, such as a drive-through or grab and go, during this closure. We will also work with schools to assist them with those plans.
We appreciate your collaboration as we work together to deal with this difficult issue.

font.b: Please be advised that the Bethlehem-Center School District will be closing school effective after today Friday, March 13, 2020. We plan a two week closure while we monitor developments of the health crisis. Please check our website for updated details. Flexible Instructional Days will not be used until they are announced on TV channels sometime AFTER the first week. We will also use Remind App to communicate regularly. Thank you for your patience as developments are rapidly changing. Stay safe and healthy!
